title: The biggest remaining roster hole for every NFL team: Where all 32 could still upgrade
description: NFL teams have added to their rosters through free agency, trades and the draft, but they all have at least one position that still needs a boost.

title: Power Rankings: Re-shuffling all 32 teams after the draft
description: Which franchises improved with their draft picks and offseason moves?

title: Cowboys reach trade for Steelers WR Pickens
description: The Cowboys and Steelers have agreed to a trade that will send George Pickens to Dallas, where he will team up with CeeDee Lamb at wide receiver.

title: Goedert to remain with Eagles in '25, source says
description: The Eagles and tight end Dallas Goedert have agreed to a reworked contract that will keep him in Philadelphia in 2025, a league source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Brady to Sanders: Use draft slide 'as motivation'
description: Tom Brady, appearing on the "IMPAULSIVE" podcast, said he texted Shedeur Sanders and told him that he needs to use his draft slide as motivation.

title: Taylor backs Fields: 'I'm here to support' Jets QB
description: Tyrod Taylor threw his full support behind Justin Fields as the Jets' starting QB.

title: Jags release Davis after disappointing '24 season
description: The Jaguars released Gabe Davis nearly 14 months after signing the WR to a three-year, $39 million deal.

title: Source: Fins' Hill has screws taken out of wrist
description: Dolphins wide receiver Tyreek Hill underwent an operation on his wrist, according to a post to his Snapchat account.

title: Source: Texans re-signing veteran DT Fatukasi
description: The Texans have agreed to re-sign veteran defensive tackle Folorunso Fatukasi, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Thibodeaux excited for Carter's impact on Giants
description: Giants linebacker Kayvon Thibodeaux said he is excited about the possibilities that No. 3 pick Abdul Carter's addition will open up for the team's defense.

title: üèà Our grades for the George Pickens trade
description: Pickens is headed to Dallas for draft picks. Did the Cowboys solve their WR2 problem -- and did the Steelers create one? Let's size up the move.

title: What should we expect from Shedeur Sanders in Cleveland?
description: Fifth-round draft picks don't typically carry the weight of expectations. Ahead of his first NFL practice, what's realistic for Sanders in a Browns uniform?

title: NFL experts debate the draft: Which midround picks could be fantasy sleepers?
description: We asked more than a dozen experts to weigh in on the draft with their top picks, Rookie of the Year predictions and fantasy sleepers.

title: Draft nuggets for every team's rookie class: Exec reaction, draft room maneuvers, remaining needs
description: With the draft dust having settled, we canvassed the league on the biggest decisions and most surprising picks.

title: What Pickens trade means for Cowboys, Steelers -- and Aaron Rodgers
description: The Steelers moved on from Pickens, while the Cowboys got a WR2 to pair with CeeDee Lamb.

title: Inside Saquon Barkley's night at the Met Gala
description: On fashion's biggest night, ESPN goes behind the scenes with the Super Bowl champion and Philadelphia Eagles star.

title: Rams will be holding mandatory minicamp in Maui
description: The Rams will spend their offseason program on June 16-18 at War Memorial Stadium in Wailuku.

title: Why the Chiefs believe final-round RB Brashard Smith was worth trading up for
description: Smith, who posted 1,600-plus total yards and 18 TDs in one season at SMU, could boost Chiefs at RB and returner.

title: How Brian Schottenheimer is putting his stamp on the Cowboys
description: Schottenheimer's energy was felt by everyone on the field at rookie minicamp.

title: Cheat Sheet Central: PPR, non-PPR, depth charts
description: Our collection of downloadable, printable cheat sheets for the 2025 fantasy football season, including PPR, non-PPR and dynasty/keeper leagues.

title: Missing stars and missed 3s: Why the Cavs and Celtics are suddenly in massive holes
description: The East playoffs have been sent into chaos. What's gone so wrong for Boston and Cleveland?

title: 'Desperate' Thunder get even, rout Nuggets by 43
description: Unwilling to fall into a 2-0 series hole, the Thunder put on a clinic in Game 2, scoring an NBA playoff record 87 points in the first half en route to beating the Nuggets 149-106.

title: Knicks 'finding ways to win,' go up 2-0 on Celtics
description: Mikal Bridges scored all of his 14 points in the fourth quarter before making his second straight game-clinching steal, and the Knicks overcame a 20-point deficit again to beat the Celtics 91-90 on Wednesday for a 2-0 lead in the second-round series.

title: After 'inexcusable' loss, Celts search for answers
description: After blowing a 20-point Game 1 lead to the Knicks and losing in overtime, the Celtics again gave up a big lead in Wednesday night's Game 2, getting walked down and passed in crunch time as New York took a 91-90 victory.

title: Curry to miss at least a week as Warriors 'adapt'
description: Warriors star Stephen Curry will miss at least one week of the playoffs after he was diagnosed with a Grade 1 left hamstring strain.

title: Finch asks NBA to review Dubs' 'shots at' Gobert
description: Timberwolves coach Chris Finch said his team submitted clips to the league office that showed what he believes was egregious contact made against center Rudy Gobert in Minnesota's 99-88 Game 1 loss.

title: Suit accuses ex-Laker Scott of '87 sexual assault
description: A woman is suing former Lakers player and coach Byron Scott, accusing him of sexually assaulting her in 1987, when he was 26 and she was 15.

title: Sources: Mavs fire top health, performance staff
description: The Mavericks have dismissed head athletic trainer Dionne Calhoun and athletic performance director Keith Belton, among others, sources tell ESPN.

title: Sources: Woodson to join Christie in Sacramento
description: Mike Woodson, who spent the past four years coaching Indiana, has agreed to join Doug Christie's Kings staff as associate head coach, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: üéµ King of TikTok: 'LeBron James' song trend
description: Professional athletes have long been name-dropped in hip-hop songs, but R&B songs comprised solely of LeBron and Curry's names? That's a more recent phenomenon.

title: 'He's our leader': Without Steph Curry, the Warriors look to Draymond Green
description: To get past the Minnesota Timberwolves, the Warriors will need their veteran star.

title: How Golden State wins without Steph: Playoff Jimmy to the rescue?
description: Steph Curry's hamstring strain is a big blow, but the Warriors' addition of Butler gives them a fighting chance.

title: NBA conference semifinals: Knicks rally to take a 2-0 lead back to MSG
description: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the second round.

title: Clutch heroics, chess moves and plenty of luck: How the NBA's final 8 win it all
description: Eight teams remain in the race to the 2025 title. Zach Kram maps the championship path for each contender.

title: How a 6-foot-4 guard became one of the most feared defenders in the NBA
description: Jrue Holiday doesn't rack up a ton of steals or blocks, but there is no player more important to the Celtics' stingy defense -- or their hopes to beat the New York Knicks and repeat as champions.

title: Full pre-lottery NBA draft order: All 59 picks over two rounds
description: Where will every team pick in the NBA draft in June? We have the full order before Monday's draft lottery.

title: Betting buzz: Curry injury shifts Warriors-Timberwolves Game 2 line five points
description: As oddsmakers continue to monitor Stephen Curry's hamstring strain, the Warriors' odds to win Game 2 against the Timberwolves have moved dramatically.

title: NBA playoff futures: Warriors odds dip following Curry injury news
description: An updated listing of the odds to win the NBA championship and Finals MVP following Tuesday's games.

title: 'Job well done': Inside Gregg Popovich's unparalleled NBA legacy
description: Friends, colleagues, players and confidantes all agree: Popovich has impacted more people across the game than perhaps anyone in history.

title: NBA offseason preview: Complete guides for Rockets, Lakers and every eliminated team
description: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Five surprising MLB performances -- and why they're happening
description: We break down a breakout bat, a prospect finally coming into his own, a power hitter who has stopped hitting home runs, and more.

title: Power Rankings: Tigers make top-5 debut as Mariners, Royals are on the rise
description: While NL powerhouses duke it out at the top of the list, a new club is leading the way in the AL.

title: Rangers recall Duran with Pillar on injured list
description: The Rangers recalled utility man Ezequiel Duran from Triple-A Round Rock on Thursday to fill the 26-man roster spot vacated by outfielder Kevin Pillar.

title: Stanton: Could rejoin Yankees when first eligible
description: Giancarlo Stanton (elbows) said he could return to the Yankees lineup by the end of the month, when he's first eligible.

title: Jays' Scherzer: Thumb 'felt good' vs. live hitters
description: Blue Jays pitcher Max Scherzer says his thumb "felt good" after throwing 20 pitches against batters for the first time March.

title: Astros optimistic on Alvarez as MRI shows strain
description: Astros slugger Yordan Alvarez has a strained muscle at the top of his right hand, a diagnosis that instills optimism he won't have a prolonged stay on the IL.

title: Cease loses no-hit bid, exits with forearm cramp
description: Moments after losing a no-hit bid in the seventh inning, San Diego Padres pitcher Dylan Cease left his start against the New York Yankees because of a cramp in his right forearm.

title: Fan hurt at PNC calls injuries 'broken everything'
description: Kavan Markwood, the 20-year-old man who was rushed to the hospital in critical condition after a fall at Pittsburgh's PNC Park last week, told TribLive he remains in pain and described his injuries as "broken everything."

title: Short-handed Dodgers staff loses Phillips to IL
description: Injuries to Los Angeles Dodgers pitchers continued to pile up Wednesday as right-hander Evan Phillips went on the 15-day injured list because of right forearm discomfort.

title: Rockies' Bryant set to undergo back procedure
description: The Rockies say Kris Bryant is scheduled to undergo a procedure on his balky back Thursday in Los Angeles and "should be back in a day or two resuming activities."

title: üí∞Passan predicts next wave of mega-contracts
description: These players are due to get paid, from who will join the nine-figure club to who could break Juan Soto's record.

title: Ranking the Red Sox's options at first base: Devers back in the infield? A prospect moving positions?
description: Boston has plenty of in-house options to fill a sudden need. Here's what those in the game think is the best choice.

title: Are the Orioles blowing their contention window?
description: The path from the top of the prospect rankings to the World Series isn't always a straight line.

title: How the kick change -- MLB's hottest new pitch -- has kick-started the Mets' rotation
description: It wasn't invented in New York, but three members of the Mets' surprising starting staff are using it -- and winning.

title: Raleigh in fantasy's top 25? Webb destined for Cy Young? Don't be surprised
description: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Five players you need to trade for right now
description: Tristan H. Cockcroft takes a look at some players who have started slowly that might turn things around .

date: Moments after losing a no-hit bid in the seventh inning, San Diego Padres pitcher Dylan Cease left his start against the New York Yankees because of a cramp in his right forearm.

title: Fan hurt at PNC calls injuries 'broken everything'
date: Kavan Markwood, the 20-year-old man who was rushed to the hospital in critical condition after a fall at Pittsburgh's PNC Park last week, told TribLive he remains in pain and described his injuries as "broken everything."

title: Short-handed Dodgers staff loses Phillips to IL
date: Injuries to Los Angeles Dodgers pitchers continued to pile up Wednesday as right-hander Evan Phillips went on the 15-day injured list because of right forearm discomfort.

title: Rockies' Bryant set to undergo back procedure
date: The Rockies say Kris Bryant is scheduled to undergo a procedure on his balky back Thursday in Los Angeles and "should be back in a day or two resuming activities."

date: These players are due to get paid, from who will join the nine-figure club to who could break Juan Soto's record.

title: Are the Orioles blowing their contention window?
date: The path from the top of the prospect rankings to the World Series isn't always a straight line.

title: How the kick change -- MLB's hottest new pitch -- has kick-started the Mets' rotation
date: It wasn't invented in New York, but three members of the Mets' surprising starting staff are using it -- and winning.

title: Raleigh in fantasy's top 25? Webb destined for Cy Young? Don't be surprised
